bibl.title: Martin DeWall v. Henry M. White.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: Filed in the United States District Court Western District of Washington
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION of MARTIN de WALL for a writ of Habeas Corpus

This matter coming on regularly to be heard upon the petition of Martin DeWall, praying for an order directed to Henry M.White, Commissioner of Labor of the United States, stationed at Seattle Washington, requiring him to show cause why he, the said Henry M.White, should further restrain the petitioner of his liberty, and the petitioner being represented by George F. Vanderveer and Ralph S.Pierce, his attorneys, and the said Henry M.White being represented by Ben L.Moore, Assistant United States Attorney, and it appearing to the court that the record and testimony in such case was transmitted to the Secretary of Labor at Washington, D.C. more than 30 days ago, and that no final order has yet been made, upon such record and testimony, and the court being fully advised in the premises,

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the prayer of the petitioner at this time be denied, with the permission to the petitioner to renew his application on December 3, 1918, or to renew his application at any time prior to said date in the event the Secretary of Labor issues a warrant for the deportation of the petitioner.
AND IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the clerk be, and he is hereby directed to send to the said Henry M.White, Commissioner of Labor at Seattle, Washington, a copy of this order forthwith.
Done in open court this 19th day of November 1918.
